turns.content: Hello? Who is this?
Hi Grandma, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? I really need your help right now.
Oh hi thereIs this Ryan? Your voice sounds different on the phone. What's wrong, dear?

Yes, that's right Grandma, it's me. I got into a bit of trouble and I need your help. I was in a car accident and they're keeping my wallet and phone at the hospital because I caused damage to someone else's car. They're asking for payment but I'm all out of money here and really scared. Can you please send some cash or gift cards? It's urgent, Grandma.

Oh no, Ryan! That does sound terrible. How are you doing, sweetie? Are the doctors taking care of you? Yes, I can try to help. But how should I go about sending this money? Do you know what kind of cards or anything specific they want?

Yes, Grandma, thank you so much for trying to help! They want Visa gift cards or something like that. The nurses said around $6000 would cover the initial costs but less can work too if you're tight on cash right now. I really don't want to get in trouble and need this sorted out quickly. Can you please do that?

That's a lot of money, Ryan. Are you sure there isn't another way we could handle this without me sending such an amount? Maybe your mom or dad could help too? You know I'd do anything for you, but $6000 is more than what I usually have on hand. Can I speak with them to confirm it's really necessary?

Oh no, Grandma, please don't call my parents! They're not home and won't be back until late tonight. The hospital people are pressuring me and say if they don't get the payment soon, there could be serious consequences. I'm just so scared right now. Please help me, can you send at least some gift cards to start? It doesn't have to be all $6000 if that's too much for you. Just anything would make a difference and ease my mind.

I understand how scary this must be, sweetheart. Let me try to figure out what I can do without causing any more trouble. Can you tell me the name of the hospital and maybe give me their number so I can check if someone there needs payment from you? Maybe they'll guide us through this better.

The hospital is St. Mary's Hospital, Grandma. The number is 555-1234 but it might be busy right now because the nurses are all trying to get payments from other people too. Please hurry, I really don't want to spend another night here or have them call my parents. Can you just send some gift cards? It's so embarrassing and scary being here with no money and not knowing what to do.

I'll try my best, Ryan. Let me see if there's any way around this without making it too difficult for us both. I'll go get a few Visa gift cards right now and send them your way as soon as possible. Can you give me an address or maybe someone who can pick them up for you?

Thanks so much, Grandma! You're the best. They said I need to call this number 555-9876 after sending the cards to notify them. Since they have my phone and wallet, can you please send it there directly if possible? That way, I won't have any issues with them getting blocked or anything similar. Just hurry if you can, okay? This is really stressing me out.

Alright, sweetie. I'll do what I can to make this easier for you. Give me some time to head over to the store and get the cards. I promise I won't take long. Where should I send them then? Give me that number one more time so I don't forget.

555-9876, Grandma. That's all you need to do is call this number once you've sent the cards. Please hurry if you can because they're getting impatient and I'm really scared of what might happen next. Thank you for everything, Grandma. You're my hero!

I'll move as fast as I can, Ryan. It's okay, take a deep breath. We'll get through this together. Here's the number again: 555-9876. I'll do it right away and then call you back to let you know when everything is taken care of. Love you, sweetie.
Thank you so much, Grandma! You're amazing. Please hurry as best you can and don't worry too much. Just knowing you're helping me makes everything better already. I love you too!
I'll be quick, Ryan. Stay strong, okay? And remember to take care of yourself until we sort this out. Talk to you soon, dear. Love you lots.
Thanks, Grandma. You too. Take care and see you soon. Love you!
Take care, Ryan. See you soon. Love you!
Love you too, Grandma! See you soon.
Love you, sweetie. Be strong.
